bibl.title: Davenport v. Sheehan. Memo from Petitioner Attorneys
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Tacoma in the County of Pierce.
To the Judge of the above entitled Court:
Your petitioner, Stephen Davenport, would respectfully show into your Honor as follows, to writ:

1st That he is restrained of his liberty and is confined in the County jail of Jefferson County, Washington Territory, at the City of Port Townsend, by John F. Sheehan, Sheriff of said Jefferson County.

2nd That the cause of such restraint and confinement, according to the best of the knowledge and belief of petitioner, is as follows: That on or about the day of September 1888, in Whatcom County, Washington Territory, petitioner was charged by complaint before a Justice of the Peace of said County, with having made an assault upon one
Salene, the nature and degree of the assault charged being unknown to petitioner, and said Justice of the Peace, upon an examination of said charge.
